Job Title

Data Scientist - GenAI

Summary

As a Data Scientist, you will bring the technical expertise needed to turn data into actionable insights and drive the development of intelligent solutions leveraging generative AI. You will be responsible for developing tools and applications that utilize cutting-edge AI models based on user requirements and enhancing the current digital workplace services portfolio.

In This Role You Will

  • Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights and support data-driven decision-making.
  • Develop and implement machine learning and generative models to solve complex business problems.
  • Create predictive and prescriptive models that positively impact business performance.
  • Apply the latest GenAI models and Large Language Models (LLMs) for conversational and generative AI, such as GPT models or open-source alternatives.
  • Design efficient prompts to interact with GenAI models using prompt engineering.
  • Develop GenAI use cases requiring the enhancement of general-purpose LLMs (e.g., Retrieval-Augmented Generation - RAG).
  • Work with GenAI frameworks such as LangChain, Hugging Face Agent, and others.
  • Work on cloud platforms using managed services like Azure ML Studio or AWS SageMaker.
  • Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate findings effectively (e.g., PowerBI).
  • Define performance indicators, analyse new models' results, and present them in an understandable way.

About The Ideal Candidate

  • Experience working with machine learning and generative AI models.
  • Proficiency in data analysis, statistical methods, and machine learning frameworks.
  • Strong proficiency in AI tools such as Azure ML Studio, AWS SageMaker, and GenAI frameworks like LangChain, Hugging Face Agent.
  • Expertise in data visualization tools like PowerBI.
  • Knowledge of GenAI models and large language models (LLMs) such as GPT.
  • Solid experience in extracting and analysing data using advanced techniques.
  • Critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data-driven insights to different audiences.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment and collaborate with cross-functional teams.

What We Can Offer You

  • 💰 A complete rewards offer - Amadeus provides attractive remuneration packages, covering all essential components of a competitive reward offer, including bonus, equity, pension plan, travel, life and healthcare insurance, as well as lunch and transport allowance and other benefits.
  • 🌎 A truly global DNA - Everything at Amadeus is global, from our people to our business, which translates into our footprint, processes, and culture.
  • 🎓 Great opportunities to learn - Learning happens all the time and in many ways at Amadeus, through on-the-job training, formal learning activities, and day-to-day interactions with colleagues.
  • 🤗 A caring environment - Amadeus fosters a caring environment, nurturing both a fulfilling career and personal and family life. We care about our employees and strive to provide a supportive work environment.
  • 🌟 A flexible working model - We want our employees to do their best work, wherever and however it works best for them.
  • 🌈 A diverse and inclusive community - We are committed to leveraging our uniquely diverse population to drive innovation, creativity, and collaboration across our organization.
  • 📈 A Reliable Company - Trust and reliability are fundamental values that drive our actions and shape long-lasting relationships with our customers, partners, and employees.
  • 🎯 A critical mission and purpose - At Amadeus, you will be powering the future of travel and pursuing a critical mission and extraordinary purpose.

Join us in shaping the future of digital workplace services through data science and AI innovation!

Diversity & Inclusion

Amadeus aspires to be a leader in Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in the tech industry, enabling every employee to reach their full potential by fostering a culture of belonging and fair treatment, attracting the best talent from all backgrounds, and as a role model for an inclusive employee experience. 

Amadeus is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, beliefs, disability or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients, and communities.

Working at WPP means being part of a global network of more than 115,000 accomplished people in 110 countries. WPP has headquarters in New York, London and Singapore and a corporate presence in major markets worldwide.

We create transformative ideas and outcomes for our clients through an integrated offer of communications, experience, commerce, and technology.

WPP and our award-winning agencies work with most of the world's biggest companies and organisations – from Ford, Unilever and P&G to Google, HSBC, and the UN. Our clients include 61 of the FTSE 100, 307 of the Fortune Global 500, all 30 of the Dow Jones 30 and 62 of the NASDAQ 100. WPP are the leader in the Bloomberg Gender Equality Index and 20th in the FTSE 100 rankings for Women on Boards.

Visit our LinkedIn page to see what we're up to!

Why we're hiring:

As a Data Scientist working at WPP within the Enterprise Data Group (EDG), you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing Machine Learning models and Generative AI solutions. You will work closely with ML Engineers, Data Engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure our AI applications are robust, scalable, and impactful.

The Advanced Analytics team within the EDG seats under the Head office Data team based in London, which oversights corporate business data. This position will be based in our Madrid office, but you will collaborate with our global team on a daily basis.

What you'll be doing:


Own and develop Machine Learning solutions to solve unstructured, complex business problems
Maintain and optimise existing Machine Learning solutions and improve them with more efficient methods
Monitor models’ performance in production to ensure the highest quality level, report on development status, identify risk areas, and support the Data Science team
Build state-of-the-art & cost-efficient solutions leveraging GenAI models for multiple use cases (summarisation, classification, chatbots)
Perform statistical analysis on existing and new datasets to help SME stakeholders identify areas for improvement
Communicate technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders successfully
Research new methods and techniques in AI/ML to improve processes and methodologies


What you'll need:


Experience with common Machine Learning frameworks and methods and developing business-oriented data solutions (e.g., data mining, process optimisation, predictive modelling)
Experience building GenAI solutions with LLMs and familiarity with both open source and Proprietary LLMs
Proficiency in using Databricks for developing and managing machine learning workflows
A background in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Maths, Statistics, Engineering), or a PhD with a focus on quantitative methodologies. Don’t be afraid to apply for this role if you come from a different background, as long as you have relevant experience
Strong coding skills: Python (it’s a must), SQL, PySpark, and R are used in across multiple projects
Hands-on experience with Machine Learning libraries such as Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, or H2O
Hands-on experience with LLMs to build RAG solutions using Hugging Face, LangChain and/or OpenAI’s models
Problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and a creative mindset
Excellent written and verbal communication
Good level of English


Who you are:

You're open: We are inclusive and collaborative; we encourage the free exchange of ideas; we respect and celebrate diverse views. We are accepting: of new ideas, new partnerships, new ways of working.

You're optimistic: We believe in the power of creativity, technology and talent to create brighter futures or our people, our clients and our communities. We approach all that we do with conviction: to try the new and to seek the unexpected.

You're extraordinary: we are stronger together: through collaboration we achieve the amazing. We are creative leaders and pioneers of our industry; we provide extraordinary every day.

What we'll give you:

Passionate, inspired people – We promote a culture of people that do extraordinary work.

Scale and opportunity – We offer the opportunity to create, influence and complete projects at a scale that is unparalleled in the industry.

Challenging and stimulating work – Unique work and the opportunity to join a group of creative problem solvers. Are you up for the challenge?

If this role hasn’t captured your interest, that’s ok! Would you consider sharing your opinion?

At WPP, we’re always trying to improve our hiring process, so your feedback is appreciated. Don’t worry, all responses will not influence any future applications that you may make.

https://forms.office.com/r/JdFf70VQdP

WPP is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability. We believe in creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion and strives to recruit a diverse slate of candidates to help us achieve that goal.

Please read our Privacy Notice (https://www.wpp.com/people/wpp-privacy-policy-for-recruitment) for more information on how we process the information you provide.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Descripción

Convertirse en Data Scientist en SimplAI significa formar parte de un equipo multidisciplinar con amplia experiencia en el sector de los servicios financieros y con los últimos conocimientos en el área de la analítica avanzada aplicada. Trabajarás en múltiples proyectos enfocados a la digitalización y optimización de procesos que abarcan desde la concepción de la solución y el desarrollo hasta la implementación, contribuyendo a generar producto y soluciones punteras de mayor valor añadido para nuestros clientes.

El proyecto

SimplAI es el acrónimo de Simple + AI, nuestro objetivo es ayudar a nuestros clientes a resolver problemas de negocio a través del uso de analítica avanzada que es entregada mediante aplicaciones ligeras de software. Trabajamos en el sector de los servicios financieros, tanto para grandes entidades como fintechs consolidadas, en España y México. Combinamos conocimiento funcional con amplio expertise analítico y tecnológico, desarrollando colaboraciones que abarcan el ciclo completo, desde la definición de la solución hasta la implantación.

Responsabilidades

Definir el futuro de las organizaciones data driven, haciendo un uso creativo de los datos para ofrecer soluciones de valor a nuestros clientes

Desarrollar nuevos modelos de analítica avanzada, de acuerdo al estado del arte, para resolver problemas de negocio reales
Crear valor y fomentar la transformación a partir del uso, la gestión y el tratamiento masivo de datos en entornos complejos
Aplicar la analítica avanzada y las técnicas de modelización en herramientas cuantitativas que faciliten la toma de decisión
Trabajar de la mano del equipo de negocio-operaciones-tecnológico
Garantizar el cumplimiento de deadlines y objetivos marcados

Requerimientos

Graduado en matemáticas, estadística, física, ingeniería o ADE con nociones/cursos de programación
Excelente capacidad analítica y de resolución de problemas
Elevada autonomía y apasionado de las nuevas tecnologías
Conocimiento de programación (foco en Machine Learning) en R o Python (preferiblemente)
Herramientas de visualización: Power BI / Tableau / Qlik
Conocimiento en el tratamiento y gestión de datos: SQL, Spark, Excel
Conocimiento estadístico deseable
Orientado a resultados y a la ejecución de proyectos
Valorable: Conocimiento de Javascript y frameworks de desarrollo web (Vue, React, Angular, etc.)

Qué ofrecemos?

Posibilidad de incorporarse a firma joven en crecimiento con amplio recorrido
Ambiente dinámico y creativo, trabajando con equipos multidisciplinares
Variedad de proyectos en clientes tanto nacionales como internacionales
Jornada flex
Paquete salarial competitivo, adaptado a experiencia
Show more

Title: Experto en Inteligencia Artificial y Machine Learning
Description:
Acerca del puesto Experto en Inteligencia Artificial y Machine Learning

¡Estamos en busca de tus habilidades!

Sabemos que buscas un cambio, estás explorando nuevos proyectos, ofertas y empresas, en Procesia tenemos la oportunidad perfecta para ti. Si te apasiona el mundo de la inteligencia artificial, el desarrollo de algoritmos, modelos estadísticos para mejorar los sistemas de computación y te gustaría trabajar con un importante cliente en la administración pública, referencia en el mundo de la tecnología. ¡Está es tu oportunidad!

Actualmente Buscamos Incorporar a Un Profesional En Este Campo

¿Qué necesitamos?


Grado en Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones, Informática, Datos e IA o Inteligencia Artificial.
Experiencia profesional en Inteligencia Artificial y Machine Learning
Conocimiento en Lenguajes de Programación como Python, Java o Go
Competencia en el uso de bibliotecas y frameworks populares de IA y machine learning, como TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Keras, o equivalentes
Conocimientos de Large Language Models (LLM) para su entrenamiento y despliegue
Experiencia en tecnologías de contenedores: implementación, gestión y optimización de tecnologías de contenedores (Kubernetes y Docker) en entornos de producción y particularmente experiencia en proyectos de aprendizaje automático


Aspectos Valorables


Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate
IBM AI Engineering Professional Certificate
European IT Certificate in AI - Machine Learning Certification
AWS Certified Machine Learning
Google Cloud Certified - Machine Learning Engineer
Cloudera CDP Machine Learning Engineer


¿Qué harías en tu día a día?


Supervisar y gestionar la infraestructura que soporta una plataforma de Machine Learning (ML), incluyendo servidores (físicos o virtuales), almacenamiento de datos y recursos de red.
Llevar a cabo el mantenimiento tanto a nivel de hardware como de software de los servidores del Laboratorio de Inteligencia Artificial (IA), para asegurar su correcto funcionamiento ininterrumpido.
Apoyar en la dirección, control y seguimiento del despliegue de servicios en la plataforma de Machine Learning (ML) del Laboratorio de IA.
Implementar políticas y herramientas para proteger los datos contra accesos no autorizados y posibles brechas de seguridad. Esto incluye la gestión de cifrado de datos, autenticación, autorización, y auditorías de seguridad.
Implementar y utilizar herramientas de monitoreo para supervisar el rendimiento de la plataforma, como Zabbix, Prometheus, Grafana o similares.
Ayudar a resolver problemas técnicos, asegurando que la plataforma esté siempre operativa. Esta actividad incluye la actualización y mantenimiento de la documentación técnica correspondiente.
Estudiar y analizar las tendencias, avances técnicos y normativos en materia de aprendizaje automático, infraestructura de TI y prácticas de seguridad.
Colaborar en el diseño y en la elección de tecnologías de IA.
Diseñar y ejecutar los estudios, proyectos y pilotos para incorporar nuevas funcionalidades en la plataforma, y colaborar en su posterior implantación.
Elaboración de informes.
Formación, apoyo técnico y asesoramiento al personal, cuando se requiera.
Análisis y redacción de documentación técnica relativa a los puntos anteriores.


No lo pienses, ¡Únete a nosotros!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Únete a Hocelot empresa de Grupo Aserta, compañía sólida con un gran potencial de crecimiento y potencia tu talento con nosotros.




Sobre la empresa:

Grupo Aserta es líder en seguros de caución y fianzas

Más de 300.000 clientes en 14 países confían en nuestras soluciones de caución para cumplir de forma más fácil, rápida y segura con sus obligaciones legales y contractuales.




Responsabilidades y Funciones:




Entregar modelos predictivos y segmentaciones de clientes centrado en el cliente y orientado a resultados.
Realizar proyectos de ciencia de datos desde la etapa de concepción hasta la entrega, el testeo y su optimización.
Colaborar en el desarrollo de procesos estandarizados y automáticos para dar respuesta a problemas de negocio mediante soluciones de analítica avanzada.
Colaborar en el desarrollo de sistemas de monitorización para los modelos de Machine Learning elaborados.
Comprender el know how empresarial profundamente para proporcionar modelos que se ajusten al contexto adecuado.
Usar técnicas de minería de datos, análisis y juicio comercial para identificar y resolver problemas comerciales
Extraer y analizar conjuntos de datos muy grandes y multidimensionales.
Apoyo en la formación de nuevos Data Scientist o integrantes del equipo.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con equipos altamente tecnológicos, generar insights y mejorar nuestros productos.




Formación y Competencias




Experiencia de más de 2 años como Data Scientist y/o área de Analítica Avanzada.
Estudios de la rama STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math)
Experiencia relevante adquirida en minería de datos / análisis avanzado, agrupación, regresión, modelos predictivos y sus principales aplicaciones.
Experiencia práctica con herramientas de programación: Python.
Conocimientos en herramientas de gestión de versiones: git.
Conocimientos en herramientas de visualización y métricas técnicas de los modelos de Machine Learning para su monitorización.
Capacidad para entregar trabajos de calidad bajo la presión de plazos.
Capacidad para comunicarse con la alta gerencia, explicando modelos y segmentaciones en lenguaje no técnico.
Capacidad para comprender la integración de aplicaciones usando Machine Learning usando plataformas en la Nube (Google Cloud).
Inglés fluido.




Oferta económica

Banda salarial de 36,000 a 39,000 euros
Variable 2 meses de sueldo anual
Beneficios

HTML:
Únete a Hocelot empresa de Grupo Aserta, compañía sólida con un gran potencial de crecimiento y potencia tu talento con nosotros.


Sobre la empresa:

Grupo Aserta es líder en seguros de caución y fianzas

Más de 300.000 clientes en 14 países confían en nuestras soluciones de caución para cumplir de forma más fácil, rápida y segura con sus obligaciones legales y contractuales.


Responsabilidades y Funciones:


  • Entregar modelos predictivos y segmentaciones de clientes centrado en el cliente y orientado a resultados.
  • Realizar proyectos de ciencia de datos desde la etapa de concepción hasta la entrega, el testeo y su optimización.
  • Colaborar en el desarrollo de procesos estandarizados y automáticos para dar respuesta a problemas de negocio mediante soluciones de analítica avanzada.
  • Colaborar en el desarrollo de sistemas de monitorización para los modelos de Machine Learning elaborados.
  • Comprender el know how empresarial profundamente para proporcionar modelos que se ajusten al contexto adecuado.
  • Usar técnicas de minería de datos, análisis y juicio comercial para identificar y resolver problemas comerciales
  • Extraer y analizar conjuntos de datos muy grandes y multidimensionales.
  • Apoyo en la formación de nuevos Data Scientist o integrantes del equipo.
  • Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con equipos altamente tecnológicos, generar insights y mejorar nuestros productos.


Formación y Competencias


  • Experiencia de más de 2 años como Data Scientist y/o área de Analítica Avanzada.
  • Estudios de la rama STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math)
  • Experiencia relevante adquirida en minería de datos / análisis avanzado, agrupación, regresión, modelos predictivos y sus principales aplicaciones.
  • Experiencia práctica con herramientas de programación: Python.
  • Conocimientos en herramientas de gestión de versiones: git.
  • Conocimientos en herramientas de visualización y métricas técnicas de los modelos de Machine Learning para su monitorización.
  • Capacidad para entregar trabajos de calidad bajo la presión de plazos.
  • Capacidad para comunicarse con la alta gerencia, explicando modelos y segmentaciones en lenguaje no técnico.
  • Capacidad para comprender la integración de aplicaciones usando Machine Learning usando plataformas en la Nube (Google Cloud).
  • Inglés fluido.


Oferta económica

  • Banda salarial de 36,000 a 39,000 euros
  • Variable 2 meses de sueldo anual
  • Beneficios

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Nuestra compañía







Somos la mayor aerolínea española y líder entre Europa y América Latina; pertenecemos al grupo aéreo IAG y formamos parte de la alianza oneworld. Nuestro objetivo es ser siempre la mejor opción para viajar para nuestros clientes y que sientan que para nosotros lo más importante es su seguridad y la calidad y experiencia de su viaje. Además de aerolínea, tenemos otros dos negocios complementarios: el mantenimiento de aviones y la carga aérea, y en todos ellos, trabajamos con clientes.

En Iberia valoramos que nuestros profesionales sean un ejemplo de comportamientos para los clientes, pero también dentro del equipo. Esperamos que todas las personas que se incorporen sean un ejemplo de estos.




Tu rol:







Un/a Data Scientist tiene como objetivo colaborar estrechamente con otros Data Scientists, Data Engineers y las unidades de negocio de Iberia para identificar, diseñar e implementar soluciones de analítica avanzada que impacten directamente en los principales KPIs de Iberia: ingresos, costes, NPS de clientes y NPS de empleados.

Formarás parte de la Dirección de Data y CRM que se ocupa principalmente de la transformación de Iberia en una compañía data driven, teniendo una alta exposición a los mandos intermedios y directivos de Iberia.







Tus retos:







Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los especialistas de la empresa para identificar oportunidades de análisis avanzado que afecten a sus principales indicadores clave de rendimiento.

Colaborar con científicos de datos senior e ingenieros de datos senior para definir la mejor solución analítica avanzada para resolver cada problema de negocio

Implementar soluciones de Aprendizaje Automático / Inteligencia Artificial aprovechando las técnicas más avanzadas: Redes neuronales, Gradient Boosting, procesamiento del lenguaje natural, etc.

Construir y manipular grandes conjuntos de datos y aplicar modelos de análisis utilizando Python/Spark en un entorno de AWS.

Crear y entregar informes escritos con los resultados, formular recomendaciones y presentar eficazmente sus conclusiones a audiencias analíticas y no analíticas.







Tus conocimientos:







Bachelor´s degree / Master in Computer Science or equivalent

Nivel avanzado de inglés

“Analytics passionate”

“Be a full-stack Data Scientist”

Gran capacidad para sintetizar conceptos complejos y presentarlos de forma sencilla a un público empresarial

Enfoque creativo y empático para la resolución de problemas

Excelentes habilidades de programación y experiencia en el desarrollo de software de calidad de producción en Python, Spark y / o R

Excelentes habilidades de comunicación para presentar resultados de manera efectiva tanto a audiencias analíticas como no analíticas

+ 3 años de experiencia en la realización de proyectos o trabajos de consultoría.

Experiencia en la construcción de soluciones analíticas a problemas empresariales.

Experiencia trabajando con grandes conjuntos de datos para desarrollar enfoques analíticos innovadores.

Experiencia avanzada en manipulación de datos con SQL (o equivalente).

Experiencia en programación en entornos Could, se valorará el conocimiento de componentes como AWS Sagemaker, Fargate y/o Airflow.







El talento en Iberia:







Valoramos que nuestros profesionales sean un ejemplo de comportamientos para los clientes, pero también dentro del equipo. Esperamos que todas las personas que se incorporen sean un ejemplo de estos.

​​​

Somos uno y diversos: Trabajas de manera coordinada, abierta y colaborativa persiguiendo un objetivo común en un entorno diverso e inclusivo.

Ponemos alma y pasión: Haces que las cosas pasen implicándote al máximo en todo lo que haces.

Reinventamos el mañana: Buscas ideas nuevas y distintas para solucionar los problemas.

Conectamos con nuestros clientes y compañeros: Siempre quieres ir un paso más allá de lo que esperan y con una sonrisa y un trato agradable.

Lo hacemos sencillo y eficiente: Ponemos foco en lo importante, analizando las situaciones y eliminando aquello que no aporta valor

Llevamos la seguridad en ADN: Trabajamos poniendo la atención y el cuidado del primer día: en cada operación en tierra, en cada vuelo. Conocemos los procesos y los aplicamos con rigor.







Nuestro compromiso con la Diversidad, Equidad e Inclusión







En Iberia somos uno y diversos. Somos un fiel reflejo de la sociedad actual y tenemos equipos con perfiles muy diversos que nos enriquecen para ser más creativos e innovadores.

Estamos totalmente comprometidos en dar las mismas oportunidades profesionales a todas las personas Para ello, todas las decisiones de los procesos de selección están basadas en las competencias, habilidades y conocimientos de la persona que aplica y que son necesarios para el rol. Trabajamos para que en todos nuestros procesos de selección haya representación de la diferencia que nos hace tan fuertes.

Title: Ingeniero/a de INTELIGENCIA ARTIFICIAL
Description:
Desde INDRA, nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un/a Ingeniero IA con enfoque en Series Temporales, y capacidad en la Toma de Decisiones, requiere experiencia en análisis de datos temporales, estrategias de toma de decisiones basadas en inteligencia artificial, y procesamiento de lenguaje natural.




¿Qué estamos buscando?

El candidato deberá demostrar habilidad en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos, sistemas de NLP para comprensión y generación del lenguaje. Esta posición exige capacidad para trabajar con grandes volúmenes de datos, identificar patrones y tendencias significativas, y aplicar este análisis en la creación de estrategias de decisión informadas y modelos lingüísticos avanzados.




¿Qué te podemos ofrecer?




Incorporarte a una compañía con más de 40.000 profesionales y con acceso a proyectos retadores para clientes líderes en sus sectores de actividad.
Una carrera profesional adaptada a ti.
Programas que promueven el desarrollo profesional de las mujeres y la adecuada integración de las personas con discapacidad.
Retribución competitiva y acceso a planes de retribución flexible.
Formación continuada en Open University, además de acceso abierto para nuestros profesionales a la plataforma Udemy for Business, con más de 3.000 cursos especializados
Conciliación entre la vida personal y profesional, con opción de flexibilidad horaria.
Acceso a plataforma MyClub donde te podrás beneficiar de numerosos descuentos y promociones exclusivos para nuestros profesionales.




Nuestro compromiso es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.




¡INDRA es empresa Top Employer 2024! Incorpórate a una empresa certificada como una de las mejores empresas empleadoras de España, gracias a nuestra gestión integral de RRHH y a las condiciones para nuestros profesionales.

Title: Dev Data Scientist & Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Why INETUM?

We are an international, agile digital consultancy. In the post-digital transformation era, we strive to ensure that each of our 28,000 professionals can continuously renew themselves.

Each of them can design their professional journey according to their preferences, collaborate with their clients to practically build a more positive world, innovate in each of the 27 countries, and balance their professional career with their personal well-being.

Our 28,000 digital athletes are proud to have been certified as a Top Employer Europe 2024.

Job Description

The DS&IA engineer identifies the needs of our customers and INETUM's internal Infrastructure teams. His or her skills and methods enable him or her to draw up specifications and identify the resources needed to ensure the success of the projects entrusted to him or her. He/she participates in data structuring, the development of artificial intelligence algorithms, the industrialization of artificial intelligence models in applications, technology watch on data science tools, etc.

His skills in statistics will enable him to support the construction of machine learning models, and his knowledge of IT will help him anticipate their production launch.

He/she will be the main contact for INETUM's Innovation teams.

He/she will report to the GBLO QASI Industrialization & Tooling organization.

Qualifications

Profile: minimum 2 years' experience


Experience in the use of methods and techniques related to MLOps (Data versioning, Experimentation, Model registries and model supervision).


Technical skills :


Expertise in machine learning algorithms and methods,
Mastery of various neural network architectures and associated development environments/libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, scikit-learn...)
Proficiency in various operating systems (Linux, Windows...)
Expertise in databases and database management (SQL/NoSQL) and vector databases
Proficiency in programming languages (C++, Java, Python, R...) and microservices architectures
Mastery of application packaging: Docker, PodMan, Kubernets
Mastery of DevOps and SRE mode development through CI/CD-type development chains
Mastery of prediction techniques: Regressions, Arima, Prophet and classification techniques: Random Forest, XGboost, LightGBM
Hyperscalers: Azure, GCP, AWS,
ELK (AI module), opensource world
Knowledge of how to use LLMs
Would be a plus: knowledge of libraries: datarobot, H2O Prediction, Dataku, ...

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - LLM
Description:
LLM - Python for Machine Learning

Experience: 2 - 15 Years

Location- Permanent Remote Anywhere in the world

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 5 hours Mandatory overlap with PST

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years Mandatory

Mandatory Skills- Python: min 2 years, Python for Data Science: min 1 yr, Machine Learning: min 1 yr, PyTorch: min 1 yr, Keras: min 1 yr, Tensorflow: min 1 yr

Key skills: Python, ML, PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow

Job Responsibilities


Develop, train, and deploy machine learning models using TensorFlow and/or PyTorch.
Implement machine learning models and preprocessing pipelines using Scikit-learn.
Apply supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, including SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forest, and k-NN, to solve complex problems.
Design and implement deep learning architectures such as CNNs, RNNs, GANs, and transfer learning models.
Explore and apply reinforcement learning techniques to enhance AI solutions.


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 2+ years of experience as a Python-focused Engineer.
1+ years of experience with Python-based frameworks for machine learning.
Proficiency in TensorFlow and/or PyTorch for model development and deployment.
Strong knowledge of Scikit-learn for machine learning model implementation.
In-depth understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, as well as deep learning architectures.


Nice To Have


Experience with Keras for quick prototyping of deep learning models.
Proficiency in Pandas and Numpy for data manipulation and preprocessing.
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in AI.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.


Skills: data science,large language models (llms),reinforcement learning,ai,unsupervised learning,pandas,gans,machine learning,deep learning,transfer learning,scikit-learn,supervised learning,rnns,decision trees,k-nn,keras,svm,pytorch,random forest,tensorflow,python,learning,ml,cnns,algorithms,numpy

Title: Data Scientist Intern
Description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic student to join our Maps Analytics and Data Engineering team in Madrid! As a Data Science Intern, you will immerse yourself in the geospatial data world, collecting, analyzing, and transforming data, and scaling-up processes to help us upgrade our maps for our end-customers!

What You’ll Do


You will help us collect large amounts of (geospatial) data and transform it into a more usable format
You will solve business-related problems using data-driven techniques
You will help us to stay on top of computational techniques such as big data computing, real-time computing, continuous development
You will identify patterns in data, as well as spotting trends that can help improving the business’s bottom line
You will communicate and collaborate with Data Scientists, engineers, product managers and Maps Operations Team globally.
Dedicate part of your weekly schedule on research and development to acquire new skills, run your own experiments.
Work in a hybrid and flexible way, combining office and remote working, that will allow you find the perfect work-life balance


What You’ll Need


You are enrolled in a Master’s degree in computer science or engineering, data science, Big Data or any other related field (Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science,...)
You are enrolled in a Spanish university
You are fluent in English
You have programming experience with Python and SQL with knowledge of software engineering principles (Object-oriented programming, testing, ...)
You have experience working with the main python libraries for data processing (pyspark, pandas, numpy,…)
You have experience with data visualization (storytelling) (e.g., dash, streamlit)
Being familiar with Microsoft cloud computing (Azure & Databricks) or any other cloud experience is a plus!


What You Can Expect From Us


You will never get bored! A company culture that likes to work hard and play hard. We like to have fun. There is no sense coming to a job every day if you don’t like the people you work with.
A diverse, multi-cultural environment
You will be part of an amazing team of data scientists, always eager to help you learn and grow!
1100 €/month (gross salary based on full-time work)
A 6-month internship contract, with a perspective to join the company afterwards
Live and work in Madrid, a cool city with loads of inspiration!


What We Offer

A competitive compensation package, of course.

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.

Work from home, the office, or even abroad – each team has the flexibility to choose how they work based on business needs.

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.

Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.

Meet your team

We’re Maps, a global team within TomTom’s Location Technology Products technical unit. Our team is driven to deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps for hundreds of millions of users around the world. Joining our team, you’ll continuously innovate our mapmaking processes, directly contributing to our vision engineering the world's most trusted and useful map.

At TomTom...

You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.

After you apply

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs .

TomTom is an equal opportunity employer

TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.

What You’ll Do

  • You will solve business-related problems using data-driven techniques

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
MYMOID is a Spanish fintech startup, leader in the payments management market and specialized in consumer finance sector. Our goal is to revolution the way digital business and e-commerces manage their payments and to improve their conversion rates and costs optimization.

Job Description We rely on powerfully insightful data to power our systems and solutions. We're seeking an experienced data scientist to deliver that insight to us on a daily basis. Our ideal team member will have the mathematical and statistical expertise you'd expect, but a natural curiosity and creative mind that's not so easy to find. As you mine, interpret, and clean our data, we will rely on you to ask questions, connect the dots, and uncover opportunities that lie hidden within—all with the ultimate goal of realizing the data's full potential. You will join a team of data specialists, but will "slice and dice" data using your own methods, creating new visions for the future.

Objectives of this Role Collaborate with product design and engineering to develop an understanding of needs.

Research and devise innovative statistical models for data analysis.

Communicate findings to all stakeholders.

Enable smarter business processes—and implement analytics for meaningful insights.

Keep current with technical and industry developments.

Daily and Monthly Responsibilities Work as the lead data strategist, identifying and integrating new datasets that can be leveraged through our product capabilities and work closely with the engineering team to strategize and execute the development of data products.

Execute analytical experiments methodically to help solve various problems and make a true impact across various domains and industries.

Identify relevant data sources and sets to mine for client business needs, and collect large structured and unstructured datasets and variables.

Devise and utilize algorithms and models to mine big data stores, perform data and error analysis to improve models, and clean and validate data for uniformity and accuracy.

Analyze data for trends and patterns, and interpret data with a clear objective in mind.

Implement analytical models into production by collaborating with software developers and machine learning engineers.

Communicate analytic solutions to stakeholders and implement improvements as needed to operational systems.

Skills and Qualifications Bachelor's degree in statistics, applied mathematics, or related discipline.

7+ years experience in data science.

Proficiency with data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis.

Advanced pattern recognition and predictive modeling experience.

Experience with Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau, SQL, and programming languages (i.e., Java/Python, SAS).

Comfort working in a dynamic, research-oriented group with several ongoing concurrent projects.

Preferred Qualifications Master's degree in stats, applied math, or related discipline.

2+ years of project management experience.

Professional certifications.

What we offer Interesting self-paced professional path in a challenging and promising sector.

Full-remote position. Work from anywhere, from the first day, until forever.

Are you an office person still? Fancy office to work from the centre of Madrid.

Team building offsite meetings with the whole crew, at least once every year.

23 vacation days, in addition to bank holidays. But also, Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve. And a happy happy birthday-off too!

English one-to-one classes.

Flexible pay for kindergarten, food or restaurant expenses.

Paid private healthcare for you included in your salary + a special discount for your family.

Apply now! We can't wait to meet you! So, why wait 'til tomorrow? Send us your resume today at ******.

Title: Data Scientist SR
Description:
¡En K-LAGAN te estamos esperando para continuar creciendo juntos!




Somos una empresa estratégica internacional de servicios tecnológicos, comprometida esencialmente con su equipo y con la sociedad. Ofrecemos soluciones en servicios IT, desarrollos de ingeniería, de electrónica, y proyectos de I+D. Nuestro compromiso es contratar a los mejores talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades, promoviendo su desarrollo profesional y personal.




Misión: Como Data Scientist participaras en el desarrollo y la implementación de modelos predictivos y análisis de datos en el área de devoluciones para un cliente retail. Este rol será crucial en cada fase del ciclo de vida de los modelos, abarcando desde la recopilación y limpieza de datos hasta el despliegue y mantenimiento en producción, garantizando la creación de soluciones de alta calidad y el éxito en la gestión de datos.




Nuestro perfil ideal cuenta con:




• Experiencia en desarrollo de modelos que estén o hayan estado en producción.

• Experiencia en proyectos de Data Science & Machine learning.

• Experiencia en Python, SQL, cloud Azure y Databricks

• Conocimiento sobre documentación de modelos y análisis.

• Capacidad de analizar grandes volumenes de datos.

• Formación o conocimiento demostrable en puesta en producción de modelos ML

• Inglés medio-alto (para codificar y documentar)

• Experiencia demostrable con Scrum / Agile




Además, en K-LAGAN, queremos que disfrutes de toda la experiencia completa de ser parte de nuestro equipo, por ello ofrecemos:




¡IMPRESCINDIBLE! Contrato indefinido y proyecto estable.

MODALIDAD: 100% Remoto

TEAM BUILDING: Barbacoas, cafés tecnológicos e igual este año se nos ocurren más cosas para estar más cerca de vosotros.

SEGUIMIENTO CONTINUO: contarás con nuestros fantásticos TBM para seguir creciendo y tener feedback sobre tu desempeño y día a día.

DEPARTAMENTO DE CARRERAS Y FORMACIÓN ¿Quieres dar el siguiente paso? ¡Te ayudamos!

EVENTOS ESPECIALES: Cena de verano, Cena de Navidad y Día Solidario.

DÍA CUMPLEAÑOS LIBRE: ¡disfrútalo cómo, dónde y con quién quieras!

AYUDAS en guarderías, KM e idiomas.

ANDJOY: Cuidamos de ti y de tu salud, con lo que cuentas con la plataforma subvencionada.

En K-LAGAN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar a los mejores talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.




¿Crees que podría ser interesante para ti?




¡Apúntate!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a talented Data scientist to join and change the world of advertising together, as we are developing the most sophisticated and intelligent AdExchange for our brands and publishers. Are you the one?




Who are we?




We are a scale-up in a 📈 hyper-growth phase so we need to ensure that our product can scale up, and we need your 🧠 brain for this!




On the contextual side, by combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision, our proprietary Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web. We find the best context for each ad, while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging to their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.




On the AdExchange side, we are creating the most efficient exchange in the market by combining Optimization, Unsupervised, and Reinforcement Learning techniques. We put together the most valuable sources of demand and supply. From our Floor Strategy on the channel side to our Header Bidding solution at the preBid connector, the AdExchange becomes smarter every day.

We want you to 💡 innovate and we have plenty of space for you to develop professionally!




As leaders of ⚙️ Contextual Advertising Technologies; at Seedtag, our goal is to promote a better advertising industry where effective advertising respects users' privacy and experience.




Key Figures




2014 · Founded

2018 · 16M€ total turnover getting growth and going international

2021 · Raised 40M€ , 230 Seedtaggers in 10 countries

2022 · Raised 250M€ , expanding into the U.S market

👉 2024 · Where will you bring us? 😎




What are our challenges?

…in numbers 🤯:

We handle more than 180 billion of events per day
We process on average 600,000 web pages per hour
Our CDN serves 1.5 petabytes every month to 200 million devices worldwide

So... it’s all about 🏎️ speed and infrastructure reliance.

Your 😎 mission (if you accept it) is to make our platform more intelligent.




Your Challenge: build the intelligence of our AdExchange

The AdExchange is the space where supply opportunities (ad slots) are matched to advertising demand items (ads). Just like the former trading pits in the stock market, opportunities to sell and buy are constantly created and resolved.




To make the most of this flow of monetization opportunities, we develop, train and deploy different Machine Learning models. At our AdExhange, you will find a myriad of use cases, each requiring different mathematical and infrastructure solutions. Our approach is strongly product-oriented, with a firm mathematical basis and proficient software development practices.




You will work close to the production environment and hand-to-hand with the team’s Data Scientists, MLOps and Data engineers, getting immediate feedback on the response of your solution. From your head to the cluster, you will have a barrier-free highway and a proactive team around you to support your work and ideas.




🚀 This is a high-impact project that will shape the future of Seedtag.
🕵🏻 You will work identifying, exploring, and making sense of data sources.
🧑‍💼 You will partner closely with the Data component of our squad, to enhance the delivery of the intelligence into the AdExchange.
⚙️ You will develop machine learning solutions to solve business problems: anomaly detection, price optimization, etc.
💻 You will develop and deploy production-oriented data software.




If you are up to the challenge and want to be a part of a talented and passionate team, we encourage you to apply for this position.




Our core values




🎯 Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.




💡Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.




👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.




📊 We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our engineering team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our systems and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




How do we work?

Our modelling stack consists of a series of well-stablished Python frameworks such as Scikit Learn/Spacy/Torch/Tensorflow, but we embrace the adoption of new cool tools.

Our backend consists of a series of containerized (Docker) microservices built in Python, and deployed in a Kubernetes cluster.




Our MLOps infrastructure is built upon MLFlow and DVC to track, trace and register the models, the metrics, and the data. We love automatizing things, and our deployments are triggered via Jenkins for the code, and MLFlow for the models. Every service API we build is self-managed, so that you can fine-tune every detail of the serving process.




Our cloud infrastructure runs on Google Cloud. We store data in Redis, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, GCS, and other storage systems. We love kafka, event-based and data-streaming architecture models.




You Will Succeed If:

🚀 You have 4-5 years of solid experience in data science and machine learning.
🧐 You (preferentially) have a degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, physics or another degree with a strong quantitative component.
📐You understand the theoretical functioning of the main algorithms in ML and you have experience applying these to real problems.
⚙️ You care about producing maintainable code over time using good programming practices. you have experience in testing and with CI/CD tools.
🌟 Nice to have: you have experience deploying models into production with docker and kubernetes. You are familiar with the MLOps universe.
🛠️ You have ample experience with one or more of these machine learning tools: Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc.
🤔 You are a big-picture thinker who can see the forest and the trees. You have a strong understanding of the technical and business requirements of the projects you work on, and you can think strategically to ensure that your work aligns with the goals of the company.
💡 You are a problem solver who loves a good challenge. You are energized by tackling complex technical problems and figuring out creative solutions.
📚 You are a continuous learner who is passionate about your craft. You are committed to staying up-to-date with the latest developments in back-end engineering and are always looking for ways to improve your skills and knowledge.
🤝 You are a strong communicator who can work effectively in a team. You are comfortable working collaboratively with others, and you are able to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
🏎️ You are adaptable and flexible. You are comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and you are able to adjust to changing priorities and requirements.

If you possess these qualities and are excited about the opportunity to work on challenging, high-impact projects with a talented and passionate team, we encourage you to apply for this position.




What else is cool at Seedtag ?

🌏 Unlimited work from home
⌛ Excellent work/life balance
🏳️‍🌈 Harassment-free, supportive and safe environment to ensure the healthiest and friendliest professional experience fostering diversity at all level
💻 Latest Macbook Pro + 🏠 1,000€ for your home setup
💼 Mentoring and Career development with learning budget
🍽️🚘👶 Restaurant, transports and kindergarten tickets
🏥 Medical insurance discounts

… but there is more !

Free 🇬🇧 English / 🇪🇸 Spanish / 🇫🇷 French lessons
🏉 Paid travel to our HQ in Madrid to gather with your teams
🥳 Paid offsite meetup with your team, yearly company gathering,🎄Christmas events…
💯 "One Seedtag": a special award which allows you to work for a month from any of our open offices with paid travel and accommodation (think of Brazil, Mexico..., 🏖)




It's really a 🚀 key moment to jump in the bandwagon with us and join the Seedtag 🥾 adventure! If you are interested in joining one of the fastest growing 📈 startups in Europe and work on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.

Show more

2018 · 16M€ total turnover getting growth and going international

2021 · Raised 40M€ , 230 Seedtaggers in 10 countries

2022 · Raised 250M€ , expanding into the U.S market

👉 2024 · Where will you bring us? 😎


What are our challenges?

…in numbers 🤯:

  • We handle more than 180 billion of events per day
  • We process on average 600,000 web pages per hour
  • Our CDN serves 1.5 petabytes every month to 200 million devices worldwide

So... it’s all about 🏎️ speed and infrastructure reliance.

Your 😎 mission (if you accept it) is to make our platform more intelligent.


Your Challenge: build the intelligence of our AdExchange

The AdExchange is the space where supply opportunities (ad slots) are matched to advertising demand items (ads). Just like the former trading pits in the stock market, opportunities to sell and buy are constantly created and resolved.


To make the most of this flow of monetization opportunities, we develop, train and deploy different Machine Learning models. At our AdExhange, you will find a myriad of use cases, each requiring different mathematical and infrastructure solutions. Our approach is strongly product-oriented, with a firm mathematical basis and proficient software development practices.


You will work close to the production environment and hand-to-hand with the team’s Data Scientists, MLOps and Data engineers, getting immediate feedback on the response of your solution. From your head to the cluster, you will have a barrier-free highway and a proactive team around you to support your work and ideas.


  • 🚀 This is a high-impact project that will shape the future of Seedtag.
  • 🕵🏻 You will work identifying, exploring, and making sense of data sources.
  • 🧑‍💼 You will partner closely with the Data component of our squad, to enhance the delivery of the intelligence into the AdExchange.
  • ⚙️ You will develop machine learning solutions to solve business problems: anomaly detection, price optimization, etc.
  • 💻 You will develop and deploy production-oriented data software.


If you are up to the challenge and want to be a part of a talented and passionate team, we encourage you to apply for this position.


Our core values


🎯 Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.


💡Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.


👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.


📊 We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our engineering team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our systems and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.


How do we work?

Our modelling stack consists of a series of well-stablished Python frameworks such as Scikit Learn/Spacy/Torch/Tensorflow, but we embrace the adoption of new cool tools.

Our backend consists of a series of containerized (Docker) microservices built in Python, and deployed in a Kubernetes cluster.


Our MLOps infrastructure is built upon MLFlow and DVC to track, trace and register the models, the metrics, and the data. We love automatizing things, and our deployments are triggered via Jenkins for the code, and MLFlow for the models. Every service API we build is self-managed, so that you can fine-tune every detail of the serving process.


Our cloud infrastructure runs on Google Cloud. We store data in Redis, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, GCS, and other storage systems. We love kafka, event-based and data-streaming architecture models.


You Will Succeed If:

  • 🚀 You have 4-5 years of solid experience in data science and machine learning.
  • 🧐 You (preferentially) have a degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, physics or another degree with a strong quantitative component.
  • 📐You understand the theoretical functioning of the main algorithms in ML and you have experience applying these to real problems.
  • ⚙️ You care about producing maintainable code over time using good programming practices. you have experience in testing and with CI/CD tools.
  • 🌟 Nice to have: you have experience deploying models into production with docker and kubernetes. You are familiar with the MLOps universe.
  • 🛠️ You have ample experience with one or more of these machine learning tools: Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc.
  • 🤔 You are a big-picture thinker who can see the forest and the trees. You have a strong understanding of the technical and business requirements of the projects you work on, and you can think strategically to ensure that your work aligns with the goals of the company.
  • 💡 You are a problem solver who loves a good challenge. You are energized by tackling complex technical problems and figuring out creative solutions.
  • 📚 You are a continuous learner who is passionate about your craft. You are committed to staying up-to-date with the latest developments in back-end engineering and are always looking for ways to improve your skills and knowledge.
  • 🤝 You are a strong communicator who can work effectively in a team. You are comfortable working collaboratively with others, and you are able to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • 🏎️ You are adaptable and flexible. You are comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and you are able to adjust to changing priorities and requirements.

If you possess these qualities and are excited about the opportunity to work on challenging, high-impact projects with a talented and passionate team, we encourage you to apply for this position.


What else is cool at Seedtag ?

  • 🌏 Unlimited work from home
  • ⌛ Excellent work/life balance
  • 🏳️‍🌈 Harassment-free, supportive and safe environment to ensure the healthiest and friendliest professional experience fostering diversity at all level
  • 💻 Latest Macbook Pro + 🏠 1,000€ for your home setup
  • 💼 Mentoring and Career development with learning budget
  • 🍽️🚘👶 Restaurant, transports and kindergarten tickets
  • 🏥 Medical insurance discounts

… but there is more !

  • Free 🇬🇧 English / 🇪🇸 Spanish / 🇫🇷 French lessons
  • 🏉 Paid travel to our HQ in Madrid to gather with your teams
  • 🥳 Paid offsite meetup with your team, yearly company gathering,🎄Christmas events…
  • 💯 "One Seedtag": a special award which allows you to work for a month from any of our open offices with paid travel and accommodation (think of Brazil, Mexico..., 🏖)


It's really a 🚀 key moment to jump in the bandwagon with us and join the Seedtag 🥾 adventure! If you are interested in joining one of the fastest growing 📈 startups in Europe and work on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST/ INGLÉS C1/ REMOTO SÓLO ESPAÑA
Description:
En experis nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un DATA SCIENTIC con inglés c1( se trabaja en inglés) y 3 años de experiencia.




PERFIL




Utilizando técnicas y enfoques avanzados de ciencia de datos para resolver problemas comerciales específicos, explore una variedad de técnicas para identificar la solución óptima.

• Resumir grandes conjuntos de datos en conclusiones significativas utilizando las herramientas disponibles; descubrir patrones y tendencias.

• Construcción de modelos predictivos y algoritmos de aprendizaje automático.

• Asumir la responsabilidad de los proyectos y liderarlos sin supervisión activa.

• Presentar la información de forma lógica utilizando herramientas de visualización de ciencia de datos.

• Interactuar con clientes dentro del banco para evaluar e identificar problemas de ciencia de datos que ofrecen las mayores oportunidades a la organización.

REQUISITOS

• Un sólido conocimiento de los fundamentos de programación, algoritmos y estructuras de datos y experiencia en lenguajes como Python y variaciones de SQL (Hive,

Impala, PostgreSQL).

• Conocimiento de técnicas de ciencia de datos con evidencia de su uso en datos en problemas comerciales de aprendizaje supervisados ​​y no supervisados. •

• Comprensión técnica de los algoritmos más utilizados: regresiones lineales, bosques aleatorios, SVM, KNN, K-means, etc.

• Experiencia en la producción de modelos de aprendizaje automático y la creación de impacto empresarial.

CONOCIMIENTOS VALORABLES

• Conocimiento práctico de las siguientes bibliotecas: numpy, scipy, pandas, scikit learn, matplotlib, seaborn.

• Experiencia en DevOps en áreas como Git y métodos de desarrollo Agile, así como exposición a servicios de computación en la nube (AWS, Google Cloud Platform,

Azure, etc.) es beneficioso.

• Nivel de grado o equivalente en una materia numérica como ciencia de datos, informática, matemáticas, ingeniería.

• Experiencia en procesamiento práctico de big data (Hadoop), visualización de datos y recuperación de información.

• Experiencia en IA Generativa, Ingeniería Rápida, AWS.







Experis, somos una compañía especializada en servicios profesionales y gestión de proyectos IT asociados a nuestras 5 prácticas: Soluciones Digitales, Cloud & Infrastructure, Enterprise Applications, Cibersecurity y Digital Workspace.




En la actualidad combinamos nuestras soluciones tecnológicas con las habilidades más demandadas del mercado. Además, proporcionamos formación especializada asociada a las líneas de servicio antes mencionadas.




Contamos con una plantilla de más de 2.000 profesionales especializados en IT en España y presencia internacional en 54 países.




Formar parte de Experis significa encontrar el desarrollo profesional que necesitas para alcanzar tus objetivos, ofreciéndote:




Proyectos y servicios con tecnologías punteras.
Acompañamiento a través de un Talent Mentor para potenciar tus capacidades.
Desarrollo profesional y plan de formación a tu medida (cursos tecnológicos, idiomas, soft skills…).
Salario competitivo acorde a tus capacidades + Retribución flexible, con revisión en base a evaluación de desempeño.
Estabilidad laboral y rotación entre diversos proyectos/servicios para potenciar tu desarrollo.
Equipos diversos (multiculturales, deslocalizados…).




Encuentra tu próxima oportunidad con nosotros. Pasa al siguiente nivel con Experis

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
En IDential necesitamos contratar un perfil de Data Scientist con ganas de incorporarse a un nuevo proyecto internacional muy interesante estable en un cliente líder del sector IT en Madrid.

¿QUÉ PODEMOS OFRECERTE?


Oportunidad de trabajar con un cliente líder en infraestructura IT.
Compañía "Great Place to Work".
Trabajo fundamentalmente en remoto.
Desarrollo personal y profesional.


Requisitos mínimos

Responsabilidades


Analizar datos sin procesar: evaluación de calidad, limpieza y estructuración para el procesamiento posterior.
Diseñe algoritmos de predicción precisos y escalables
Colaborar con el equipo de ingeniería para llevar prototipos analíticos a producción.
Genere información procesable para mejorar el negocio


Calificaciones


Licenciatura o experiencia equivalente en el campo cuantitativo (Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática, Ingeniería, etc.)
Al menos 1 o 2 años de experiencia en análisis cuantitativo o modelado de datos.
Comprensión profunda del modelado predictivo, el aprendizaje automático, las técnicas y algoritmos de agrupación y clasificación.
Fluidez en un lenguaje de programación Python y sus librerías
Valorable conocimiento en NLP


¿Crees que puedes encajar? No dudes en apuntarte a la oferta para contarte más detalles esta oportunidad.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Buscamos perfiles Licenciados o Ingenieros con inglés B2 para participar en el programa de formación con empleo garantizado que hemos lanzado conjuntamente con la escuela MOA. Los seleccionados recibirán una formación intensiva de 105 horas en Analítica Digital y, a la finalización de la formación, se incorporarán a la plantilla de una de las empresas tecnológicas que participan en el programa.




¿Qué buscamos?

Es imprescindible contar con alguna de las siguientes titulaciones: Graduados (FP Superior o Licenciatura) en ciencias STEM
Nivel B2 de Inglés
Muchas ganas de estudiar para saltar al sector digital
No hace falta tener experiencia




Requisito indispensable: Completar una formación no remunerada y con coste asociado a través de financiación ISA




¿Qué ofrecemos? 💼

El salario anual de entrada será de entre 20.000 euros y 24.000 euros
Ubicación: Madrid/Barcelona, resto de España consultar
Tipo de contrato: Indefinido
Modalidad: Híbrido (3 días en oficina, 2 días teletrabajo)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Remote Spain)
Description:
At Intelygenz, we envision a future where processes accelerate performance. For the companies we work with, this means finding ways to optimize their data using cutting-edge technologies like AI-enabled automation. This mindset is a huge part of our culture. We thrive on pooling our skills, collaborating on projects, helping one another learn and creating innovations.

What are you going to do?

As a Machine Learning Engineer, your responsibilities will be:
Designing and implementing end-to-end inference pipelines.
Designing and implementing ETL pipelines for AI solutions deployed on production environments.
Designing and implementing Feedback Loop for AI solutions deployed on production environments.
Fine-tuning of ML and DL models for production purposes.

What will make you succeed in your role?✌️:

Wide experience working with GIT
Minimum experience in deploying and maintaining ML models in production.
Minimum experience in working with Docker and/or Kubernetes.
Minimum experience working with different database types such as SQL, Document-oriented, Key-Value, and Time Series.
Minimum experience working with some event brokers such as Kafka, RabbitMQ, NATS...
Experience working with API frameworks.
Minimum experience working with Protobuf.
Data Architectures designed for exploiting and using Machine Learning techniques.
Modeling fine tune for ML and DL algorithms.
Minimum experience using Python 3.8+ and PyTorch.
Some experience with GoLang.
High control of the different steps regarding the ML experiments to execute.
Fluent in English for day-to-day, customer meetings and reporting.
Strong self-taught and proactivity capabilities.
Problem-solving and autonomy when facing new challenges.

Bonus Points:

Experience working with Kubernetes.
Experience working with Graph databases.
Comfortable with TDD/ATDD.
Comfortable with fully automated CI/CD environments.
Other programming languages: Node.js, C/C++ or Java.
Desire to learn & constant curiosity.
Ability to adapt to different environments and projects.




After applying, what will the process be like?

📲 Firstly, you will start with an Initial Interview with the Talent Team.

⌨ Then, you will continue performing the technical assessment.

💯 You will always get complete feedback about your performance.

👫 If the feedback is positive, you will have a technical interview with a colleague.

📖 Last but not least, the final stage will be an offer.




Why Intelygenz?

100% Flexible 🧑🏻‍💻

Flexible schedule and 100% freedom to work from anywhere you’d like (Spain based)

Career Plan & Mentoring 🚀

Specific career plans for horizontal and vertical growth plus mentoring to help you grow in your career. Let your motivations do the talking!

Unlimited Learning 📚

English classes, paid events, Udemy courses and one hour per week to take part in continuous tech training programs with your co-workers. Sky is the limit!!

Always be yourself 👐🏽

Don't be afraid of who you are! You will feel embraced and supported by the team and the whole company.

Happy Hours... ❤️

... and an Intelygenz Anniversary exclusive T-Shirt

Flexible retribution - restaurant, transport and nursery
Salary range💲: 45.000-54.000€
